posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Hello all!
Bumped here to present one of the builds used in the last month (with great pleasure); some time ago I searched for builds specialized in more than one weapon and more than 10 RDD levels; this was an intriguing concept, as more RDD levels mean more AC than the one provided by bard skill dumps and armor skin feat.
To preserve shield AC in the most difficult moments, the specialization should be obtained both in a 1-hand and a 2-hand weapon.

Having found none of them (as specialization in two weapons is taken by either CoT builds - Mick's Brawler is the first one that comes into my mind - or builds with the same class split but with fighter levels >=20), I chose to design it; she has performed well in WoG server, and now she is lv 39: her setting is general, and there have not been customization for that particular environment.
AB is 48, and I didn't want to push it further to take many RDD levels pre-epics, and help boost Will save (one of the meelers' Achilles' heel); an high-AB should also help to raise AC (through expertise/improved expertise) without risking a lot of miss attacks; disarm attempts also help to raise AB.

Weapons chosen are warhammer and halberd to cover all damage types, some alternatives can be:
  • Scythe instead of halberd;
  • Morningstar and greatsword.

Analysis of other builds using the same classes, but with more than 10 RDD levels (to list all the RDD 10 build would be too long):
  • Universal warrior by Empyre 65 (Fighter 12 / Bard 8 / RDD 20): great build, capable to use all types of weapons (and without any specialization), 44 AB.
  • DRACO MAULER by Valerfor (FTR 10/ BARD 4/ RDD 26): 45 AB, 700 HP, EDR II tank, specialization in one weapon.
No builds with more than 10 RDD levels have been posted in the old ECB guild.

Some thoughts from my part:
  • take fortitude save boosts instead of will (which is already a modified 20);
  • maximize concentration to resist taunts and preserve AC, in spite of listen.
Delightful to hear any comment or suggestion!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Its a really strong build Aquarius
It reminds me a lot of Vudash Lurken 🤔
Any suggestions are tweaks
Will save 22 with +9 to saves vs spells and UMD (for prot v alignment/mind blank) is in reality effective will 31, as most mind affecting abilities are spells, apart from traps (ie sonic traps) 
Swapping it for great fortitude to help against implosion/dev crit/death magic is a nice tweak depending on the situation.
Same with listen vs concentration. Sneakers can be killers I personally worry more about those than being taunted

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, I do like this one, Aquarius! I'll take her out for a run myself, in fact. (Not looked at the second version yet, I'm afraid.)

I've only a couple of thoughts - mostly about personal preference. I'd lose Imp Expertise and insert Imp Knockdown. I might also do a little feat juggling and get Luck of Heroes rather than Iron Will. My only other thought is to take EWF in both weapons before taking EWS in both - you've masses of STR damage in any case, so landing hits takes priority for me.

Very impressive work!

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Orion wrote:
Jun 26, 2020
Its a really strong build Aquarius
It reminds me a lot of Vudash Lurken 🤔
Bingo! She IS Vudash! Half-orcs rule! 😀
This is one of the few builds whose KD (at lv 3) landed against casters!

ok thank you for your comments: so en route to swap will boost saves with great fortitude (or epic fortitude for v2)!
Improved expertise has been chosen as her AB is very high, and with a bless/bulls potion (or +5 weapon/STR boost items) the further -5 AB loss (compared to expertise) is compensated; this has performed well also with bosses in WoG (although I think that, for the most powerful ones, this trick won't work as she would have to aim for 19 or 20s to hit).

In less harsh environments I would almost surely choose IKD and considerate your advice, Stag; however, during my playtesting, I found that (with the necessary caution) giants and dragons are wacked before they can be a threat to this build (if I forget to equip in time a belt of minor guiding light or use a clarity potion before approaching the dragon's fear aura, that is my fault).

Good point on Luck of Heroes!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you are going to hit only on a 20 anyway, you might as well use (Improved) Expertise to try to make the enemy also have to fish for 20s, or (Improved) Power Attack to make it really count when you do hit.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Agree with Empyre65's and Stag's points
One observation: when I've partied with Aquarius's build Vudash can still hit a lot (not just on a 20) with improved expertise active, due to the mundane 48 AB :)
Allowing teammates (such as my Greatsword Kensai) to hit em with flanking attacks :)
But very difficult bosses with high AC - improved expertise is very useful with the 20 rolls as Empyre mentions, including to reduce the number of crits if they are still hitting the character.
One could swap iron will for improved knockdown (I do like IKD too) but maybe the extra saves is better in a tough environment, and rely on the high AB of the build for knockdown attempts?
